lexUnit.name: crow.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: utter its characteristic loud cry.

sentence.text: Nobody ! " she crowed .
` Yes , it is , " the cripple crowed .
` It 's on now , " he crowed triumphantly .
` Why a Tudor princeling did , " she crowed .
` Bravo , bravo , " the princess crowed , sitting back and clapping her hands .
` The nerve of it , " he crowed .
` I had done it , " Marek crowed , ` I had killed the man who had betrayed my father , and I was exhilarated .
` There you are , then , " Myra crowed .
` I do n't mean forgery , " she crowed triumphantly .
You just repeat it like a machine , " crowed Julian .
` Well , well , well , well , well , " crowed Jonathan .
` Perfect , " crowed Mr Yarrow .

Aunt Margaret , radiant , tickled the fat baby padding on Victoria 's ribs and the soles of her soft feet , bouncing and wrestling her , shaking with soundless laughter while Victoria crowed her delight .
` Endorado ! " crowed the front page of the Daily Star on Saturday .
` Now I know you 're charlatans ! " crowed the secretary triumphantly .
This allowed the company to crow about the new models that cost no more than the old -- a favourite Ford device but by no means exclusive to the blue oval badge .

Those who thought it would fall to pieces within 5000 miles were confounded , even if those who hoped it would sail the test with BMW-like dependability could hardly crow about its reliability record .
And even if you score a triumph , avoid crowing about your success .
He crowed to me : ` The Queen wo n't allow any negotiations between Andrew and Fergie and their lawyers to go on without me being present . "
` It 's her ! " she crowed with delight .
` That was super stuff , " he crowed after his Lions had come from behind to end Swindon 's unbeaten start to the season .
